I would be more inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they a=
re going to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few sec=
onds of audio like Ursula's example.....
=C2=A0
what??? how would you know =
that when I only took a piece out of the picture..the face i posted did NOT=
 show up multiple times NOR did I say it did...why do you ALWAYS have to ac=
t as if you no everything...this is something that you just heard what a co=
uple of days ago...guess what..I knew about this a year ago! The person tha=
t Frank mention is a mentor of mine so this is not a OMG moment for me....
=
=C2=A0
I'm not getting angry but I am getting annoyed..you act as if i post=
ed something with big letter saying OMG stop the press. why are you hating =
on my results...lets see yours..you no what I'm going to say to you? good j=
ob can't Wait to see more..OR don't say nothing ...even more so when you do=
n't no what your talking about.
=C2=A0
ok so what the point of the reply? m=
ostly to say.. I did not get the same face in the whole recording actually =
only at the end...


--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@gmail=
.com> wrote:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com
Date: Saturday, December 18, 2010, 4:57 PM


=C2=A0 



No, I don't t=
hink I am being too critical, but I may have expectations that are a little=
 too high. =C2=A0I want to take my time with this. =C2=A0For my own underst=
anding, I need to have a large sample size so I know not only what to expec=
t to see, but what to look for. =C2=A0I have seen ITC snapshots from progra=
ms like this that offer full faces. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to belie=
ve in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may=
 not be eyebrows. 


Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face=
. =C2=A0If you have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal)=
 you can extrapolate out what the entire face would look like. =C2=A0This i=
s something I would like to get myself and I would consider that evidence i=
f it showed up in one of these programs. =C2=A0But, if you have something t=
hat looks like a forehead and that is all there is, then it could also look=
 like a rock or some other such object.


I am certainly hoping for results=
 worked into box sessions. =C2=A0Directing a session with intent, like sayi=
ng "I am going to examine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of=
 seeing your face. =C2=A0Is it possible you can show your face to me now th=
rough sound? " is what I am after. =C2=A0If a positive hit like this happen=
s, then I will be jumping for joy. =C2=A0Another good example would be a na=
me, lets say Tom, that occurs. =C2=A0If you get a positive affirmation that=
 the name you heard is present, then you try the same technique only you ad=
dress Tom by name and get a face, that would be even better.


But, as it s=
tands now, the faces as they appear are random at best. =C2=A0I would be mo=
re inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they are going to o=
ccur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of audio=
 like Ursula's example. =C2=A0If this where the case, there would be dozens=
, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and I just do=
n't think that is possible. =C2=A0This is why I need to look at several sam=
ples to find out if this is the case or not. =C2=A0If these partialized fac=
es occur in multiples all the time, I would be more apt to discount it. =C2=
=A0But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens, I w=
ould be more inclined to believe in them. =C2=A0Sample size is everything. =
=C2=A0It is like listening to GBC. =C2=A0If you have never done a session b=
efore, you would be inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a commu=
nication. =C2=A0Only by continued practice (expanding your sample size) can=
 you start to
 rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy. =C2=A0


O=
n the other hand, I am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong. =C2=
=A0I will continue to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best. =
=C2=A0


I really want this to work. =C2=A0As you have probably experienced=
, when they want you to hear something or know something, they make it very=
 obvious while communicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they apply this same rigor =
to this new format to show us that they are there. =C2=A0If they can, then =
the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skep=
tics be damned!


Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 2:24 PM, Frank Sumption <pu=
rplealiengirl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's unrealisti=
c to expect every file to have faces and images. These faces are often just=
 portions, eyes and lips, some have eye brows. Like all of this, not done f=
or proof, it's for emotional impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that shows up =
in towels, always just half the face. Perahps you are being too critical? A=
s with all spirit messages, it's what it means to the experiencer that matt=
ers. Expecting full faces is like expecting the kings english and proper gr=
ammer in all EVPs. 
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Wo=
olworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple which co=
uld be construed as images in the one series you had from SEA, but nothing =
that knocked me over the head yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see a larger=
 sample size before I determine if what you have witnessed is in fact a for=
m or not. =C2=A0I cannot accept an image as paranormal without knowing wher=
e it sits among the bulk of audio files. =C2=A0If every file has multiple f=
aces, the I would have =C2=A0to say that there is nothing there. 


So, I w=
ill certainly keep testing with my copy and hopefully something will really=
 pop for me. =C2=A0I have run through about ten files (EVP and GBC) so far =
for intensive study and I still haven't got anything that I would consider =
a positive hit. =C2=A0I need an actual formed face, not portions thereof, t=
o consider an image real. =C2=A0This is the only way to discount visual mat=
rixing.


I have high hopes for this though!


Tim 





On Sat, Dec 18, 20=
10 at 5:01 AM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 







=

On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 1:00 AM, psi_research <vilhell=
m@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions=
 where GB output is fed directly into the mic line in on a computer running=
 Adobe Audition with the spectragraph running. It was really compelling to =
see letters and numbers, not images or pictures, but partial words appear i=
n the graph. At first it was I thought it was a software glitch but it is a=
 repeatable event. It was on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood, he also th=
ought there was some kind of code error but it happened on more than one we=
bcast. 

So if anyone has Audition, just feed Box output right in your comp=
uter and see what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity a=
nd the spectragraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Auditi=
on does so it's not able to render images or characters, at least as far as=
 I see using the various settings.


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Tim Wo=
olworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:
>
> I have tried numerous EVP files and sh=
ort box clips and so far

am. I still have a lot of
> hope though.
> 
> I don't know about you guys, =
but I am going to try to work this in to a
> session tonight!
> 
> Tim

<DIV>No, I don't think I am being too critical, but I ma=
y have expectations that are a little too high.  I want to take my tim=
e with this.  For my own understanding, I need to have a large sample =
size so I know not only what to expect to see, but what to look for.  =
I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like this that offer full faces. &n=
bsp;I would be more inclined to believe in such an image as opposed to, let=
s say. two dark lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DI=
V>Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face.  If you have=
 half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolat=
e out what the entire face would look like.  This is something I would=
 like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if it showed up in o=
ne of these programs.  But, if you have something that looks like a fo=
rehead and that is all there is, then it could also look like a rock or som=
e other such object.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am certainly hoping for r=
esults worked into box sessions.  Directing a session with intent, lik=
e saying "I am going to examine the sound waves of this communication in ho=
pes of seeing your face.  Is it possible you can show your face to me =
now through sound? " is what I am after.  If a positive hit like this =
happens, then I will be jumping for joy.  Another good example would b=
e a name, lets say Tom, that occurs.  If you get a positive affirmatio=
n that the name you heard is present, then you try the same technique only =
you address Tom by name and get a face, that would be even better.</DIV>
<D=
IV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>But, as it stands now, the faces as they appear are rand=
om at best.  I would be more inclined to believe that when these faces=
 do occur , they are going to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple i=
mages in a few seconds of audio like Ursula's example.  If this where =
the case, there would be dozens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a t=
en minute session and I just don't think that is possible.  This is wh=
y I need to look at several samples to find out if this is the case or not.=
  If these partialized faces occur in multiples all the time, I would =
be more apt to discount it.  But, if they are a rarity affixed to only=
 a few clips out of dozens, I would be more inclined to believe in them. &n=
bsp;Sample size is everything.  It is like listening to GBC.  If =
you have never done a session before, you would be inclined to believe ever=
y stray radio signal is a communication.  Only by continued practice
 =
(expanding your sample size) can you start to rule out stray radio with any=
 degree of accuracy.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On the other hand, I=
 am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong.  I will continue =
to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best.  </DIV>
<DIV><B=
R></DIV>
<DIV>I really want this to work.  As you have probably experi=
enced, when they want you to hear something or know something, they make it=
 very obvious while communicating.  I am hoping they apply this same r=
igor to this new format to show us that they are there.  If they can, =
then the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one source and then the=
 skeptics be damned!</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Tim<BR><BR>
